answers.answer: I didn't have any problems with mine....it actually didn't feel no different than my other two labors

Yes! Please refuse it. I'm so tired of hearing people trying to make their babies come out before its time. Most people don't even wait till after their due dates. The longer the baby stays in there the better it is for the baby, cause it's still developing & has less chances of having problems such as breathing, heart, lungs, etc. The baby knows when it's ready. And it will let you know.

If the doctors think it is medically necessary, I would not refuse it....When they want to induce, it is for a reason. Trying to get yourself induced because you're sick of being pregnant is another story.

Only refuse unless it is medically necessary. I was induced for preeclampsia. My labor was hard, I ended up getting stuck at 5 cm and needed an emergency section. 30 hours of contractions for nothing lol. But if I had refused I could have died from the preeclampsia.

With my first I was having contractions but not dilating on my due date. The doctor induced with patocin to see if it would help me dilate, they had no luck. They decided to manually break my water and that is when they found out that my sons head was pushing so hard on my cervix it had no space to dilate. Once they broke my water and  helped to reposition the baby. Then within 4 hours I had my handsome boy. Other than the pressure from them moving the baby I don't feel that having been induced caused anything negative. Honestly after he was born they realized that if he would have stayed in any longer he could have been seriously ill due to having swallowed some fecal matter due to having a bowel movement prior to birth.-- I wish you the best with your baby.
I'm having the same problem.I don't want it because I don't need it I've had a healthy pregnancy and I think he's just taking longer. I'm gonna refuse it unless I really need it.
Well ladies I'm almost 41 weeks and super miserable. I really wish they would just schedule a c-section. Just for the fact that my cervix is not favorable. I'm 1cm and 50% effaced.

You don't have to do it. Its not unsafe until 42 weeks to still be pregnant. But just because you're 1cm doesn't mean it will be hard for you. Yes it hurts but labor does anyway. I was induced 10 days late with my first it took 7hrs from the time my contractions started.

I was induced with my second son because of him having an irregular heartbeat and ended up in labor for almost 2 days. It was horrible. I'm so nervous that I'll have to be induced this time also because I'm already 38/1 and it seems like labor is nowhere in sight

question: Should I refuse it? I heard its harder and more stress on the baby.
title: Induced labor.
